meanings.definition: An instrument used to measure the volume of air inspired and expired by the lungs.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a spirometer to check how much air I could breathe in and out.
meanings.sent2: The spirometer showed that my lung capacity was normal for my age.
meanings.sent3: I pretended the spirometer was a magical breathing wand during the lung test.
meanings.sent4: Her lungs were like a spirometer, inhaling life's challenges and exhaling resilience.
meanings.sent5: The spirometer beeped softly as it recorded the air flow in and out of my lungs.

meanings.definition: A device used to assess lung function by measuring the amount of air inhaled and exhaled.
meanings.sent1: During the check-up, the nurse asked me to blow into the spirometer.
meanings.sent2: The spirometer results indicated that his breathing was improving.
meanings.sent3: The spirometer and I had a race to see who could blow the most air out.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a spirometer, always measuring his progress.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained how the spirometer helps monitor lung health with each breath.
